page.title: 11My Memories of the Infants
page.content: The infants school which I attended was small but pleasant. The classrooms were full of colourful pictures as well as the hall in which there was a picture of the Royal Familly on one wall opposite a picture of an aeroplane on the other. The hall was full of P.E apparatus amongst which my favourite was the rope ladder. Every Thursday we had country dancing, and on Tuesdays we had "Time & Tune". Each year during the Summer we had a sports day and when all the races were finished we had an ice lolly. At my last Christmas in the school I took part in the school play "Hansel & Gretel" (I played the father. I was sad to leave the school which was tragically burnt down in a fire which I witnessed. The school was completely destroyed but I will never forget old Hilldene school.
